snippet: The Fire Department official who on Sunday oversaw the rescue of Asher Vongtau, 19, said he could not recall a situation quite like it in his 33-year career.
abstract: Asher Vongtau, New York University sophomore, survives fall between two TriBeCa buildings, but was trapped, undetected and badly injured in tiny crevice for nearly 36 hours; New York City Fire Dept rescue operations officials, who had to quickly execute a rescue through the wall of a garage, say that it is possible given Vongtau's position and layout of buildings that he was on roof of his 18-story dormitory when he fell.
lead_paragraph: The Fire Department official who on Sunday oversaw the rescue of Asher Vongtau, 19, said he could not recall a situation quite like it in his 33-year career.

headline.main: For 36 Hours, N.Y.U. Student Was Trapped Between 2 Buildings
headline.print_headline: Caught Between Two Buildings For 36 Hours, And Surviving
